hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The URL of the git repo for Platform Management.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: GIT_REF
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The branch of the git repo for Platform Management.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash -ex
if [[ -z $GITLAB_USER || -z $GITLAB_PASSWORD ]]; then echo "Missing GITLAB_USER or GITLAB_PASSWORD" exit 1 fi
echo -e "Host ${GITLAB_HOST_NAME} StrictHostKeyChecking no " >> ~/.ssh/config echo -e "Host innersource.accenture.com StrictHostKeyChecking no " >> ~/.ssh/config echo -e "Host newsource.accenture.com StrictHostKeyChecking no " >> ~/.ssh/config
# install jq sh ${WORKSPACE}/common/utils/install_jq.sh export PATH="$PATH:$HOME/bin"
echo "Getting the Gitlab token" get_response=$(curl -I -X POST "${GITLAB_HTTP_URL}/api/v4/session?login=${GITLAB_USER}&password=${GITLAB_PASSWORD}") response=$(echo $get_response | head -1 | awk '{print $2}')
echo $get_response
if [[ $response -ne 201 ]]; then echo "$GITLAB_USER is unauthorized to access ${GITLAB_HTTP_URL}/api/v4/" exit 1 fi
GITLAB_TOKEN=$(curl -X POST "${GITLAB_HTTP_URL}/api/v4/session?login=${GITLAB_USER}&password=${GITLAB_PASSWORD}" | jq '.private_token' | tr -d '"')
if [[ $GITLAB_TOKEN -ne "null" ]]; then echo "Token is null" exit 1 fi
echo "Adding ssh key" key=$(cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub) curl -v --header "PRIVATE-TOKEN: $GITLAB_TOKEN" -X POST "${GITLAB_HTTP_URL}/api/v4/user/keys" --data-urlencode "title=jenkins@adop-core" --data-urlencode "key=${key}"
echo "Create the platform-management repo in ${GITLAB_HTTP_URL}" target_repo_name="platform-management" curl -v --header "PRIVATE-TOKEN: $GITLAB_TOKEN" -X POST "${GITLAB_HTTP_URL}/api/v4/projects?name=${target_repo_name}"
echo "Create a gitlab repository for platform management" git remote add adop git@${GITLAB_HOST_NAME}:root/$target_repo_name.git git fetch adop git push adop +refs/remotes/origin/*:refs/heads/*
set +x # Add the GITLAB_TOKEN to a file for execute system groovy script use, it will be deleted at the end echo "$GITLAB_TOKEN" > /tmp/gitlab_token_file
# Create SonarQube Administrator user token curl -u "${INITIAL_ADMIN_USER}:${INITIAL_ADMIN_PASSWORD}" "http://sonar-web:9000/api/user_tokens/search" | jq '.userTokens[].name' | tr -d '" ' > tokens.txt tokens=$(cat tokens.txt) if [ ${#tokens[@]} -gt 0 ]; then for token in $(cat tokens.txt); do if [ $token == "adop-token" ]; then echo "deleting existing token in sonarqube" curl -v -X POST -u "${INITIAL_ADMIN_USER}:${INITIAL_ADMIN_PASSWORD}" "${SONAR_SERVER_URL}/api/user_tokens/revoke?name=adop-token" fi done fi
adop_sonar_token=$(curl -X POST -u "${INITIAL_ADMIN_USER}:${INITIAL_ADMIN_PASSWORD}" "${SONAR_SERVER_URL}/api/user_tokens/generate?name=adop-token" | jq '.token' | tr -d '" ')
if [ adop_sonar_token == "null" ]; then echo "Could not get the token for user ${INITIAL_ADMIN} in sonarqube server ${SONAR_SERVER_URL}" exit 1 fi
echo "Passing SonarQube token to /tmp/sonar_token_file" echo $adop_sonar_token > /tmp/sonar_token_file
